intro: Sutera stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf suture plant, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Sutera stenophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
